dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 9191 IH: Presidential Budget Accountability Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Carter of Georgia (for himself, Mr. Emmer, Mr. Finstad, and Mr. Weber of Texas) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Reform, and in addition to the Committee on the Budget, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend title 31, United States Code, to limit the use of Federal funds for travel by the President if the President’s annual budget submission to Congress is late, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Presidential Budget Accountability Act.

section.header: Limitation on use of Federal funds for presidential travel expenses if President’s budget is late
section.text: Section 1105 of title 31, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: If the budget under subsection (a) is not submitted to Congress on or before the first Monday in February of a year, during the period beginning on the first Tuesday of February of such year and ending on the date the budget is submitted, no Federal funds may be obligated or expended for the travel expenses of the President.
